page.title: 19AN OLD LADYS MEMORIES
page.content: WHEN WE WERE DOING OUR SURVEY WE HAD TO INTERVIEW AN OLD LADY WHO WAS LIVING IN AN OLD FARM HOUSE NEAR BECKHAM PALACE. AFTER A FEW INITAL QUESTIONS SHE SOON STARTED TALKING. SHE RETIRED TO THE AREA MANY YEARS AGO. HER HUSBAND DIED AND SHE LIVES ALONE. HE COULD REMEMBER COMING TO BECKHAM PALACE WHEN SHE WAS A GIRL, SHE PROVIDED US WITH ALL OF OUR INFORMATION ABOUT IT. SHE COULD REMEMBER WHEN THERE WERE NO TRACTORS, HORSES WERE USED FOR EVERYTHING, THE TRACTORS SLOWLY APPEARED ON THE SCENE AND THE JOB BECAME MUCH EASIER FOR THE FARMERS, BUT, AS A RESULT OF THE NEW MACHINERY MANY OF THE FARM LABOURERS HAD TO GO TO THE TOWNS AND CITYS FOR JOBS. THIS WAS PROBABLY THE EASIEST INTERVIEW THAT WE HAD TO DO. {G.TOONE
